title: Graph: Node Scan
subtitle: Full _concepts table scan (ConceptStore)
methodology: Scan all N nodes in _concepts (id, key, kind, data). Tests graph abstraction overhead.
whyItMatters: Graph node scans drive knowledge base discovery. 2.8x faster scans mean agents explore more concepts per turn.

title: Graph: Edge Scan
subtitle: Full _relations table scan (RelationStore)
methodology: Scan N edges in _relations (source_key, target_key, kind, data). Tests RelationStore performance.
whyItMatters: Edge scans power relationship discovery - how agents find connections between concepts for reasoning chains.

title: Graph: Node Seek
subtitle: Single node by integer key (B-tree)
methodology: Look up node by integer key via graph index seek (O(log N) ConceptStore). Measured: Sharc 421ns vs SQLite 26,000ns (62x).
whyItMatters: Single-concept lookups happen on every agent tool call. Sub-microsecond index seeks keep tool latency imperceptible.

title: Knowledge Expansion (BFS)
subtitle: Traversing 2-hop neighborhood of a concept
methodology: Expanding the local knowledge graph for an agent. Sharc uses zero-allocation cursor BFS: edge-only 2-hop traversal with cursor Reset(). Measured: 2.60μs vs 81.55μs.
whyItMatters: Graph traversal is how agents expand context - from one fact to related concepts. 31x faster traversal unlocks real-time knowledge exploration.
